title: Arellano: Shea Serrano's 'Expensive Basketball' headlines remarkable year for Latino sports books
description: Gustavo Arellano highlights a special year for Latinos in sports, with Fernando Mendoza winning the Heisman and four strong sports books released.
fullText:
When Fernando Mendoza won the Heisman Trophy this weekend with another Latino finalist looking on from the crowd, the Cuban-American quarterback did more than just become the first Indiana Hoosier to win college football‚Äôs top prize, and only the third Latino to do so. He also subtly offered a radical statement: Latinos don't just belong in this country, they're essential.

At a time when questions swirl around this country‚Äòs largest minority group that cast us in a demeaning, tokenized light ‚Äî how could so many of us vote for Trump in 2024? Why don't we assimilate faster? Why does Supreme Court justice Brett Kavanaugh think it‚Äôs OK for immigration agents to racially profile us? ‚Äî the fact that two of the best college football players in the country this year were Latino quarterbacks didn‚Äôt draw the headlines they would‚Äôve a generation ago. That‚Äôs because we now live in an era where Latinos are part of the fabric of sports in the United States like never before.

That‚Äôs the untold thesis of four great books I read this year. Each is anchored in Latino pride but treat their subjects not just as sport curios and pioneers but great athletes who were and are fundamental not just to their professions and community but society at large.

Shea Serrano writing about anything is like a really great big burrito ‚Äî you know it‚Äôs going to be great and it exceeds your expectations when you finally bite into it, you swear you‚Äôre not going to gorge the thing all at once but don‚Äôt regret anything when you inevitably do. He could write about concrete and this would be true, but his latest New York Times bestseller (four in total, which probably makes him the only Mexican American author with that distinction) thankfully is instead about his favorite sport.

‚ÄúExpensive Basketball‚Äù finds Serrano at his best, a mix of humblebrag, rambles and hilarity (of Rasheed Wallace, the lifelong San Antonio Spurs fan wrote the all-star forward ‚Äúwould collect technical fouls with the same enthusiasm and determination little kids collect Pok√©mon cards with.‚Äù) The proud Tejano's mix of styles ‚Äî straight essays, listicles, repeated phrases or words trotted out like incantations, copious footnotes ‚Äî ensures he always keeps the reader guessing.

But his genius is in noting things no one else possibly can. Who else would‚Äôve crowned journeyman power forward Gordon Hayward the fall guy in Kobe Bryant‚Äôs final game, the one where he scored 60 points and led the Lakers to a thrilling fourth-quarter comeback? Tied a Carlos Williams poem that a friend mistakenly texted to him to WNBA Hall of Famer Sue Bird? Reminded us that the hapless Charlotte Hornets ‚Äî who haven‚Äôt made it into the playoffs in nearly a decade ‚Äî were once considered so cool that two of their stars were featured in the original ‚ÄúSpace Jam?‚Äù "Essential Basketball" is so good that you‚Äôll swear you‚Äôll only read a couple of Serrano's essays and not regret the afternoon that will pass as quickly as a Nikola Jokic assist.

I recommended ‚ÄúMexican American Baseball in the South Bay‚Äù in my regular columna three years ago, so why am I plugging its second edition? For one, the audacity of its existence ‚Äî how on earth can anyone justify turning a 450-page book on an unheralded section of Southern California into an 800-page one? But in an age when telling your story because no one else will or will do a terrible job at it is more important than ever, the contributors to this tome prove how true that is.

"Mexican American Baseball in the South Bay" is part of a long-running series about the history of Mexican American baseball in Southern California Latino communities. What's so brilliant about this one is that it boldly asserts the history and stories of a community that too often get overlooked in Southern California Latino literature in favor of the Eastsides and Santa Anas of the region.

As series editor Richard A. Santillan noted, the reaction to the original South Bay book was so overwhelmingly positive that he and others in the Latino History Baseball Project decided to expand it. Well-written essays introduce each chapter; long captions for family and team photos function as yearbook entries. Especially valuable are newspaper clippings from La Opini√≥n that showed the vibrancy of Southern Californians that never made it into the pages of the English-language press.

Maybe only people with ties to the South Bay will read this book cover to cover, and that‚Äôs understandable. But it‚Äôs also a challenge to all other Latino communities: if folks from Wilmington to Hermosa Beach to Compton can cover their sports history so thoroughly, why can‚Äôt the rest of us?

One of the most surprising books I read this year was Jorge Iber‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Sanchez Family: Mexican American High School and Collegiate Wrestlers from Cheyenne, Wyoming,‚Äù a short read that addresses two topics rarely written about: Mexican American freestyle wrestlers and Mexican Americans in the Equality State. Despite its novelty, it‚Äôs the most imperfect of my four recommendations. Since it's ostensibly an academic book, Iber loads the pages with citations and references to other academics to the point where it sometimes reads like a bibliography and one wonders why the author doesn‚Äôt focus more on his own work. And in one chapter, Iber refers to his own work in the first person ‚Äî profe, you‚Äôre cool but you're not Rickey Henderson.

‚ÄúThe Sanchez Family‚Äù overcomes these limitations by the force of its subject, whose protagonists descend from Guanajuato-born ancestors that arrived to Wyoming a century ago and established a multi-generational wrestling dynasty worthy of the far-more famous Guerrero clan. Iber documents how the success of multiple Sanchez men on the wrestling mat led to success in civic life and urges other scholars to examine how prep sports have long served as a springboard for Latinos to enter mainstream society ‚Äî because nothing creates acceptance like winning.

‚ÄúIn our family, we have educators, engineers and other professions,‚Äù Iber quotes Gil Sanchez Sr. a member of the first generation of grapplers. ‚ÄúAll because a 15-year-old boy [him]‚Ä¶decided to become a wrestler.‚Äù

Heard that boxing is a dying sport? The editors of ‚ÄúRings of Dissent: Boxing and Performances of Rebellion‚Äù won‚Äôt have it. Rudy Mondrag√≥n, Gaye Theresa Johnson and David J. Leonard not only refuse to entertain that idea, they call such critiques ‚Äúrooted in racist and classist mythology.‚Äù

They then go on to offer an electric, eclectic collection of essays on the sweet science that showcases the sport as a metaphor for the struggles and triumphs of those that have practiced it for over 150 years in the United States. Unsurprisingly, California Latinos earn a starring role. Cal State Channel Islands professor Jos√© M. Alamillo digs up the case of two Mexican boxers denied entry in the United States during the 1930s, because of the racism of the times, digging up a letter to the Department of Labor that reads like a Stephen Miller rant: ‚ÄúCalifornia right now has a surplus of cheap boxers from Mexico, and something should be done to prevent the entry of others.‚Äù

Roberto Jos√© Andrade Franco retells the saga of Oscar De La Hoya versus Julio Cesar Ch√°vez, landing less on the side of the former than pointing out the assimilationist fa√ßade of the Golden Boy. Mondrag√≥n talks about the political activism of Central Valley light welterweight Jos√© Carlos Ram√≠rez both inside and outside the ring. Despite the verve and love each ‚ÄúRings of Dissent‚Äù contributors have in their essays, they don't romanticize it. No one is more clear-eyed about its beauty and sadness than Mondrag√≥n‚Äôs fellow Loyola Marymount Latino studies profe, Priscilla Leiva. She examines the role of boxing gyms in Los Angeles, focusing on three ‚Äî Broadway Boxing Gym and City of Angels Boxing in South L.A, and the since-shuttered Barrio Boxing in El Sereno.

‚ÄúEfforts to envision a different future for oneself, for one‚Äôs community, and for the city are not guaranteed unequivocal success,‚Äù she writes. ‚ÄúRather, like the sport of boxing, dissent requires struggle.‚Äù

If those aren‚Äôt the wisest words for Latinos to embrace for the coming year, I‚Äôm not sure what is.

Get the best, most interesting and strangest stories of the day from the L.A. sports scene and beyond from our newsletter The Sports Report.

This story originally appeared in Los Angeles Times.

title: Khalil Shakir start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Khalil Shakir ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The 10-4 Buffalo Bills head to chilly Cleveland to take on the 3-11 Browns this Sunday. The Bills are coming off a big win against the Patriots, but need to keep up their winning ways for a good shot at the AFC East title. This could be a letdown spot for the Bills, but they are 10.5-point road favorites. They should be able to overcome any big game hangover.

One player they need to get going is Khalil Shakir. He‚Äôs shown good upside, but his usage fluctuates wildly. Can we trust him in the fantasy playoffs this week?

Below, we‚Äôll go over Khalil Shakir‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

If you‚Äôre looking for a consistently strong floor from Shakir, you aren‚Äôt going to get it. Since Week 8 he‚Äôs had three games where he was WR29 or better and five where he was WR33 or worse. Over the last three weeks he has seen 4, 3, and 5 targets. The five games before that, his target numbers were much better at 7, 8, 9, 3, and 10. He‚Äôs just too inconsistent to count on this week if you can help it.

title: Harold Fannin Jr. start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Harold Fannin Jr. ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The 3-11 Cleveland Browns host the 10-4 Buffalo Bills as 10.5-point underdogs this Sunday. At this point the Browns are looking toward next season, and specifically at Shedeur Sanders and whether he has a shot at being a starter in the league.

Sanders‚Äô best target so far has been rookie tight end Harold Fannin Jr., but last week he only put up 48 yards on a whopping 14 targets against a not great Bears defense. Will he be worth starting in the fantasy playoffs against the Buffalo Bills?

Below, we‚Äôll go over Harold Fannin Jr.‚Äòs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

First off, the Bills have been the best team in the NFL at keeping opposing tight ends from scoring fantasy points. They completely shut down Hunter Henry last week and through 14 games, they‚Äôve allowed 38 receptions for 459 yards and two touchdowns. That‚Äôs an average of 2.7 receptions for 32.7 yards and .142 touchdowns per game.

All of that is to tell you that it won‚Äôt be easy, but when you‚Äôre the No. 1 target for a quarterback who just threw you 14 passes attempts, you start in fantasy.

title: Khyri McKenzie honoured on 2025 Football Black List
description: Brentford Women forward Khyri McKenzie was honoured last week as part of the 2025 Football Black List, an award that celebrates influential Black figures and positive role models across British footba...
fullText:
Alongside a strong campaign with Carly Williams‚Äô side, McKenzie is driving forward her business, McKenzi3Kickz, aimed at closing the gap between grassroots and academy football for girls, with education, mentorship and opportunity the focus.

Founded in 2008 by journalists Leon Mann and Rodney Hinds, the Football Black List highlights leaders from all areas of the game, with nominees put forward by the public before a panel featuring representatives from the Premier League, English Football League, Football Association, League Managers Association and Kick It Out finalise the list. McKenzie‚Äôs recognition places her among figures who are making a meaningful impact both within football and beyond it.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs something I‚Äôm really proud of,‚Äù McKenzie said. ‚ÄúTo be recognised in that way means a lot, not just for what I‚Äôm doing on the pitch, but for the work I‚Äôm trying to do to help others. It shows that people are paying attention and that the message is landing.‚Äù

McKenzie joined Brentford Women in the summer of 2025 and has been a key figure in Williams‚Äô side this season. She has registered six goals and one assist in 12 appearances across all competitions, playing an important role as the Bees remain firmly in the promotion mix.

Away from matchdays, McKenzie is also the founder of McKenzi3Kickz, a business created to help girls who want to play football overcome accessibility barriers within the game. Through workshops and events supported by Go London, she has secured ¬£15,000 of funding alongside 12 months of mentorship, enabling her to scale the project and focus on long-term impact.

‚ÄúThat support has allowed me to really push forward with my bigger vision,‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúA lot of the barriers for girls come from a lack of access to information and guidance, and that‚Äôs what I want to change.‚Äù

A central part of that vision is the development of a dedicated app for young players in the women‚Äôs game, designed to create a safe community space focused on mentorship, education and support. McKenzie plans to host an interview series within the platform, speaking to physiotherapists, psychologists, grassroots and academy coaches, performance staff and nutritionists.

‚ÄúI believe what women need is support, and it shouldn‚Äôt just be academy players who get it,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúGrassroots players deserve the same education around injury prevention, nutrition, rehab, and how to prepare for trials. If we start teaching the younger generation now, they‚Äôll be in a much better place when that big opportunity comes.‚Äù

McKenzi3Kickz also runs an annual tournament for both Under-16s and Over-16s, giving girls the chance to attend individually or as part of a group. With prizes, raffles and the hope of showcasing an early version of the app, the tournament provides valuable exposure at a time when summer opportunities for girls‚Äô football can be limited.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lack of tournaments for girls during the summer,‚Äù McKenzie said. ‚ÄúThis gives coaches a chance to come and spot talent, parents a chance to support their children, and players a space where they feel seen. My aim is to help close the gap between academy and grassroots football and make that transition more accessible.‚Äù

‚ÄúI believe what women need is support, and it shouldn‚Äôt just be academy players who get it'

‚ÄúI study sport rehabilitation, so I see how important it is that the right investment goes into the right areas.

"Being able to go into schools and share that knowledge is a huge opportunity for me.‚Äù

Looking ahead, McKenzie is optimistic about the future, with plans for one-to-one support sessions and five-a-side opportunities forming part of the next phase of McKenzi3Kickz in 2026.

title: Jason Pierre-Paul is back with Bucs so nice guys don‚Äôt finish last
description: Jason Pierre-Paul will be 37 on New Year‚Äôs Day, hasn‚Äôt played in an NFL game in two years or produced more than three sacks in any season since helping the Bucs win Super Bowl 55 following the 2020 season. When Tampa Bay signed him to its practice squad on Dec.
fullText:
Jason Pierre-Paul will be 37 on New Year‚Äôs Day, hasn‚Äôt played in an NFL game in two years or produced more than three sacks in any season since helping the Bucs win Super Bowl 55 following the 2020 season.

When Tampa Bay signed him to its practice squad on Dec. 9, it wasn‚Äôt just to put pressure on opposing quarterbacks. The team felt it could use him to put heat on some of its own players on defense.

Buy FIRE THE CANNONS: 50 Years of Tampa Bay Buccaneers Football

The Bucs didn‚Äôt just need an edge rusher. They needed an edge, someone whose passion might boil over into an opponent‚Äôs penalty. A teammate they would watch with a side-eye, never fully sure what he might do next. A player who made opponents uncomfortable and injected an attitude the locker room couldn‚Äôt manufacture.

In addition to an overall lack of consistent pressure from their defensive line and outside linebacker positions, the Bucs lack someone teammates are afraid to let down.

Think about the best Bucs teams from the past. The Super Bowl 37 champions were stuffed with those kinds of players on defense. Warren Sapp. Even safety John Lynch, who is about as even-tempered off the field as anyone you will ever meet, was borderline maniacal between the lines. He knocked his brother-in-law (Bears tight end John Allred) out cold in a 1997 game at Soldier Field.

Hardy Nickerson was that guy when Lynch, Sapp and Derrick Brooks arrived.

It also helps that Pierre-Paul has a resume. He owns 94 ¬Ω career sacks and 21 forced fumbles. Outside linebacker Yaya Diaby leads the Bucs with only six sacks this season.

Less than two weeks after Pierre-Paul was signed to the practice squad, Diaby says he‚Äôs benefited from the two-time Super Bowl champion‚Äôs counsel.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been good so far, man,‚Äù Diaby said. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt even lie. He‚Äôs very intentional with what he‚Äôs done and what he sees that we‚Äôve been doing that he can improve upon. Even for me, he‚Äôll come up and say, ‚ÄòThis is what you can do to get off real faster. You could‚Äôve done this or done that.‚Äô

‚ÄúSo, he‚Äôs been real intentional in trying to share whatever he can. Even (Wednesday), he was telling me, ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt know everything. But what I do know, I can help you with that.‚Äù

On Saturday, Pierre-Paul was elevated from the practice squad for Sunday‚Äôs game at Carolina. Head coach Todd Bowles had said earlier in the week that Pierre-Paul was ‚Äúin play‚Äù for the NFC South showdown, even with no players forced to miss the game due to injury.

‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs coming in and getting back acclimated systematically in some of the things we‚Äôre asking him to do,‚Äù defensive pass game coordinator George Edwards. ‚ÄúBut I think he‚Äôs been very attentive. It‚Äôs bought into calling some of the plays he‚Äôs done in the past. He‚Äôs here working hard, so we‚Äôll see how it goes. You never know when your number is called to be in those situations.‚Äù

Pierre-Paul‚Äôs energy and passion for the game is infectious, Diaby said.

‚ÄúHe loves it, and he‚Äôs still got some juice,‚Äù Diaby said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs still got some juice.‚Äù

There‚Äôs been far too many miscommunications on the Bucs defense this season. Much of it is on the players. Some of it is opponents going fast to prevent an array of blitzes and coverages to be communicated before the snap.

It‚Äôs one of the reasons why there have been so many missed assignments, a player out of position here or there because the communication breaks down.

Bowles always has been known for the complexity of his defense and the ability to disguise an array of blitzes. But those take time to communicate.

Consequently, opponents are getting to or staying on the ball quickly between snaps.

‚ÄúOn third down, they speed it up some,‚Äù Bowles said. ‚ÄúWe expect that. We‚Äôve been getting that for the last two years. We have to have calls ready. We understand that, and we do have calls ready. We expect to get sped up some.‚Äù

The Bucs and Panthers are both 5-1 in games decided by three points or less this season.

What makes them able to execute in pressure situations?

‚Äúit‚Äôs just playing smart football,‚Äù Bowles said. ‚ÄùWe have to play smart football, and you can‚Äôt beat yourselves and you‚Äôve got to execute.‚Äù

title: Browns vs. Bills radio coverage: Station, channel, streaming to listen live to NFL Week 16 game broadcast
description: Buffalo is closing in on a playoff spot.
fullText:
Browns vs. Bills radio coverage: Station, channel, streaming to listen live to NFL Week 16 game broadcast originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Buffalo Bills‚Äô dramatic Week 15 victory over the New England Patriots was far more than a simple rivalry win; it was a season-saving, division-defining statement.

Trailing 21-0 in the first half at Gillette Stadium, quarterback Josh Allen led the Bills on a historic comeback, scoring five consecutive touchdowns to erase the deficit and secure the thrilling 35-31 win. The victory was crucial, as it prevented the Patriots from clinching the AFC East title on their home turf and kept Buffalo's own slim division hopes mathematically alive heading into the final three weeks of the season.

More importantly for their immediate postseason aspirations, that massive win cemented the Bills (10-4) as the leading Wild Card contender in the highly competitive AFC playoff picture. Currently holding the No. 6 seed, Buffalo‚Äôs favorable tiebreakers give them a strong foothold as they enter a demanding closing schedule. With the Los Angeles Chargers and Houston Texans nipping at their heels, maintaining momentum is essential to avoid being dragged back into the desperate fight for the final playoff spots.

That urgency brings the Bills to Cleveland this Sunday for a pivotal matchup against the Browns (3-11). While Cleveland has struggled through a disappointing season, their defense ‚Äîled by the perennial Defensive Player of the Year candidate Myles Garrett ‚Äîremains highly disruptive. The quarterback battle is one to watch: Shedeur Sanders will make his fifth NFL start against the reigning MVP in Josh Allen.

Ultimately, Sunday's clash at Huntington Bank Field is an absolute "must-win" for Buffalo. Having survived the biggest challenge of their season by battling back against the Patriots, the Bills cannot afford a letdown against a struggling opponent if they want to secure their spot in the postseason for a seventh straight year. A win would keep the pressure squarely on New England in the AFC East race and put Buffalo on the very brink of officially punching their ticket as the top team in the AFC Wild Card standings.

National radio channels:¬†SiriusXM¬†channel 227 (home), 382 (away)

Browns radio channel:¬†92.3 The Fan, 98.5 WNCX and ESPN 850, The Cleveland Browns Radio Network

The matchup between the Browns and Bills can be found nationally on SiriusXM (channel 88), along with team-specific channels. The Bills can be found on 382 and the Browns on 227.

Locally, fans in the Buffalo area can tune into WGR 550, which carries Bills games throughout Western New York. In Cleveland, the Browns utilize a unique triple flagship station network: 92.3 The Fan, 98.5 WNCX, and 850 ESPN for their local coverage.

If you are a new subscriber to SiriusXM, you can often get your first month for free. This gives you live access to every NFL game, plus other sports like college football, MLB, NBA, and NHL.¬†Stay updated with all the news and analysis from SiriusXM NFL Radio and other sport-specific channels.

The Bills and Patriots will kick off at 1:00 p.m. on Dec. 21. The game will be broadcast on CBS.

title: Orioles news: Reactions to the Shane Baz trade
description: There‚Äôs a lot of praise to be found for the Orioles doing something else aggressive.
fullText:
There are now 95 days remaining until Orioles Opening Day 2026. If this weekend is any indication, things are not going to be sleepy from now until Christmas or even from then until the new year. Does Mike Elias have another (perhaps the last) substantial move in him before the calendar turns?

A couple of days after the Shane Baz trade, in some ways I feel like I did after the Orioles signed Pete Alonso. I can‚Äôt believe that it happened! This is not something that Elias has done before now, making a big trade that included multiple players who might have been regarded among the team‚Äôs top 10 prospects in an aggressive deal to try to shore up one of the team‚Äôs weaknesses for seasons at a time.

He is serious about doing something different this year. Going out and getting Baz is of a much different character than settling for short-term signings of Tomoyuki Sugano and Charlie Morton. There is an upside here that not much of what he did last offseason had going for it. My efforts to talk myself into the Baz trade center largely around how much better he was on the road this past year (3.86 ERA), which will hopefully prove to be a more representative floor for his performance than his results from George Steinbrenner Field ‚Äì a minor league stadium that won‚Äôt be in use in 2026 and won‚Äôt be Baz‚Äôs home park in any case.

Even so, I‚Äôd like to see the Orioles go in and aim for the top end of the free agent market. If they go out and get whoever they like the best between Framber Valdez, Ranger Su√°rez, and Tatsuya Imai, and then turn out to be right about that guy, that would set up a potentially pretty darn good rotation for the team. Crucially, they would be in a position to have much better backup plans than they did a year ago, too. I think there‚Äôs going to be some movement coming in the top end even as we slide towards Christmas and then the new year.

If you can imagine this, everybody has still got a lot to say about Shane Baz!

Elias on Baz: ‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs kind of a perfect fit for us in our rotation and our team right now? (School of Roch)
Orioles believe Baz to be a No. 3 starter, but more additions not out of question (Orioles.com)
At long last, Mike Elias and the Orioles are taking big swings this offseason (The Baltimore Banner)
What they‚Äôre saying about the Orioles trade for Shane Baz (Baltimore Baseball)

You don‚Äôt have to look very far in the mainstream baseball media to find people who like Baz and what the Orioles are aiming for in this deal.

Today in 1995, the Orioles signed future Hall of Famer Roberto Alomar to a three-year contract. Alomar averaged about 4.2 bWAR per season of the contract. Two of those years were 1996 and 1997, great years for the franchise. Pretty good signing!

There are several former Orioles who were born on this day. They are: 2019-20 pitcher Asher Wojciechowski, 2012-13 catcher Taylor Teagarden, 2006 reliever LaTroy Hawkins, 1995 outfielder Andy Van Slyke, 1996 pitcher Roger McDowell, and 1977 outfielder Elliott Maddox. Today is Maddox‚Äôs 78th birthday, so an extra happy birthday to him.

Is today your birthday? Happy birthday to you! Your birthday buddies for today include: dog breeder Jack Russell (1795), actress Jane Fonda (1937), musician Frank Zappa (1940), actor Samuel L. Jackson (1948), tennis star Chris Evert (1954), and French president Emmanuel Macron (1977).

In 1620, the pilgrims from the Mayflower came ashore in what is today Plymouth Rock, Massachusetts.

In 1879, the play A Doll‚Äôs House by Henrik Ibsen had its world premiere in Copenhagen.

In 1913, a new thing called the ‚Äúword-cross,‚Äù designed by Arthur Wynne, was published in the New York World. This was the first published instance of what we now know as a crossword puzzle.

In 1988, all 259 passengers and crew of Pan Am Flight 103 and 11 people on the ground were killed when a bomb exploded in the plane and the wreckage crashed onto Lockerbie, Scotland.

And that‚Äôs the way it is in Birdland on December 21. Have a safe Sunday.

title: Bo Nix‚Äôs backyard style was discouraged by coaches, including his dad
description: "It's cool to go back and watch those and you're like, ‚ÄòMan, I didn't even realize it looked like,'" Bo Nix said of his unconventional passes.
fullText:
It doesn't have to be conventional -- if it works.

Denver Broncos quarterback Bo Nix has turned heads this season with no-look throws, falling-down touchdown passes and various unconventional throwing angles. He's been discouraged from playing like that since he was a kid -- even by his father, Patrick Nix, who coached him in high school.

‚ÄúI think I've always been able to do it," Nix said of his unique throws. "It was probably from playing baseball as a young kid to playing football, and just a lot of different backyard styles of play. But early on in your career, a lot of people told you that wasn't how you were supposed to do it, and you had to do it a different way, my dad being one of them. So you work to be on platform and to throw it with the perfect mechanics every time. Sometimes it works that way, and you get to do it and other times it doesn't. I think the ability to be able to use different angles just helps you within the pocket, helps you navigate windows.

"It can be tough on a defense. They can't really time you up and get batted passes or just gives you another opportunity if they got a hand in your face, whatever it may be. It's just like a shooter getting a shot off in a different way, getting to the rim, and having a shooter lay up in a different spot. Every once in a while, you want to be in a perfect shooting position, but sometimes that doesn't happen, and so have to have a different angle or whatnot. I think it's a strength that a lot of guys are working on, and I think it's just going to get more and more creative honestly as guys move forward.‚Äù

One of Nix's off-platform throws was a whipped pass to tight end Evan Engram against the Green Bay Packers on Sunday. Engram plucked it out of the air with one hand to help keep things alive on a crucial drive.

Bo Nix hits Evan Engram who snags the ball with one hand

Sweet game yesterday!

(excuse the audio equipment) pic.twitter.com/6GMaFYfbkj

‚Äî BroncoBlog (@MileHighDubs88) December 15, 2025

Most underrated play from Sunday imo

3rd and long early, drive in jeopardy, need a TD to take the lead.

Bo gets the ball out awkwardly, narrowly avoiding Parsons, Engram snags it with one hand, sheds a tackle and gets us to 4th and 1, leading to a sneak and later a TD that‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/hTZ0M9BT31

‚Äî Bryce üé∏ (@MileHighMims) December 16, 2025

‚ÄúSometimes it's just athleticism, sometimes it's just a reaction," Nix said. "At that point, my eyes saw Evan as open and my body reacted to getting him the football as quickly as possible. I think it just, you know, automatically went to a way of throwing that I could do, but the fastest one that I had. It's cool to go back and watch those and you're like, ‚ÄòMan, I didn't even realize it looked like that or didn't even realize that's what I did.‚Äô Sometimes it's just sudden movements, and you train your body to be quick. You definitely have to practice that way. You have to practice full speed at all times, try to get different looks at it. But that ended up being one of the most important plays in the game.‚Äù

Nix and Co. now turn their attention toward the Jacksonville Jaguars, who will visit Empower Field at Mile High on Sunday. With a win (and some help from other teams), the Broncos can clinch an AFC West title and the No. 1 seed in the conference this weekend.

Social: Follow¬†Broncos Wire¬†on¬†Facebook¬†and¬†Twitter/X!¬†Did you know:¬†These 25 celebrities are Broncos fans.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: NFL: Coaches (including his dad) discouraged Bo Nix's backyard style

title: Jake Ferguson start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Jake Ferguson ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The 6-7-1 Dallas Cowboys welcome the 10-4 Los Angeles Chargers as 2.5-point home favorites on Sunday. The Cowboys aren‚Äôt completely out of the playoff race, but would need to win out, while the Eagles to lose out ‚Äî and they play the Commanders twice. But, with even that sliver of hope, I‚Äôd expect them to put their best out there this week.

And their best has often included TE Jake Ferguson, who has had a great fantasy season. Ferguson hasn‚Äôt scored over the last four games after finding the end zone seven times in his previous seven games. Has he slowed down or is it the usual touchdown regression?

Below, we‚Äôll go over Jake Ferguson‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

The Chargers are ninth-best at stopping tight ends from scoring fantasy points this season. Derwin James can do that to you. But, Ferguson continues to see good usage. He hasn‚Äôt topped 60 receiving yards since Week 3, so we would very much like for him to score a touchdown this week in our fantasy playoffs.

The good news is that Ferguson has still been getting looks in the red zone, with five RZ targets over his last four scoreless games. I see no reason to sit him this week and expect a good showing from the TE4 in fantasy for the year.

title: Colorado football hires Chris Marve as Deion Sanders reshapes staff
description: Colorado football and head coach Deion Sanders are adding an experienced defensive mind to his staff as the Buffaloes navigate a tough offseason.
fullText:
As the Colorado Buffaloes navigate a mass exodus to the¬†transfer portal, head coach Deion Sanders is getting his coaching staff in order.

Sanders is strengthening his defensive staff by hiring former Virginia Tech defensive coordinator Chris Marve, who is expected to be named Colorado's linebackers coach, per CBS Sports'¬†Matt Zenitz.

In addition to the Marve hire, Sanders is bringing in¬†former Sacramento State head coach Brennan Marion¬†as his offensive coordinator and will make additional staff moves after Colorado assistant Brett Bartolone's¬†move to Nevada.

As a player, Marve was a four-time all-SEC linebacker and has spent 11 seasons coaching. He served as Virginia Tech's defensive coordinator for three years. In his time as the Hokies' defensive coordinator, he led them to second in total defense in 2023. In 2025, the defense ranked 72nd in the FBS and allowed 32.8 points per game, the second-worst in the ACC.

Colorado struggled mightily on the defensive side of the ball in 2025, especially at linebacker. Only one linebacker broke 60 total tackles, while the next closest had 48. The Buffaloes' linebackers also failed to execute run stops, resulting in Colorado ranking second-worst in the FBS.

Colorado is expected to hire ex-Virginia Tech defensive coordinator Chris Marve as linebackers coach, sources tell @CBSSports.

The former three-time All-SEC linebacker led the way as Va Tech ranked first in the ACC in red zone defense in 2024 and second in total defense in 2023. pic.twitter.com/XH04fi4a7q

‚Äî Matt Zenitz (@mzenitz) December 20, 2025

Contact/Follow us@BuffaloesWire on X (formerly Twitter), and like our page on Facebook for ongoing coverage of Colorado news, notes and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Buffaloes Wire: Colorado football hires Chris Marve to bolster defensive staff

title: Omarion Hampton start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Omarion Hampton ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The Los Angeles Chargers take their 10-4 record and current 5 seed to Dallas on Sunday to face the 6-7-1 Cowboys as 2.5-point road dogs on Sunday. The Cowboys have a sliver of a chance at sneaking into the playoffs, while the Chargers are in at the moment, but can‚Äôt let off the gas just yet.

Running back Kimani Vidal played well in RB Omarian Hampton‚Äôs absence and now that Hampton has returned, Vidal has continued to play more snaps than the rookie, but Hampton has more touches. In the two games since he returned, Hampton has seen 31% and 36% of the snaps to Vidal‚Äôs 69% and 64%. In total touches, Hampton has 15 and 16 to Vidal‚Äôs 15 and 13.

Below, we‚Äôll go over Omarion Hampton‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

The split between Hampton and Vidal is based on the ‚Äúhot hand‚Äù approach so far, which doesn‚Äôt give us much to go on. Hampton did see more short yardage work while Vidal saw more third-down work, but toward the end of their Week 15 game, Vidal took over a big chunk of all the plays.

I‚Äôd say we can count on them splitting work, with a lower floor for both, but still decent upside as well, just a little more inconsistent than we‚Äôd hope. The Cowboys have been better against the run since acquiring Quinnen Williams, but we also just saw the Lions rush for four touchdowns against them.

Williams is in concussion protocol, but has returned to limited practices. If he can‚Äôt be cleared, feel much better about starting both Chargers backs, but even if he does play, I‚Äôm flexing both still.

title: Travis Kelce start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Travis Kelce ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The 6-8 Kansas City Chiefs travel to Nashville on Sunday to take on the 2-12 Tennessee Titans. The Chiefs are just 3-point favorites against the lowly Titans because they lost Patrick Mahomes to a season ending ACL/LCL tear. Gardner Minshew will take over Mahomes, which has shrunk their implied team total to 20.5. If Mahomes was behind center, I‚Äôd expect that number to be 27 or more. So, Minshew will likely slow down the offense, but does that mean you should bench TE Travis Kelce?

Below, we‚Äôll go over Travis Kelce‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

Kelce has been much better than I thought he would be this season. He looked completely washed for much of last season, but he‚Äôs proven me wrong and put up strong fantasy numbers. It also helps that Andy Reid can scheme him open and that Mahomes and Kelce have a great connection. Now with Minshew in there, we can wonder if Kelce will see a big decline or keep up his usual stats.

What we have going for Kelce is that Minshew is going to dink and dunk, much like Mahomes, and he‚Äôs going to try to get the ball to Kelce. Plus, the Titans defense is not good. Over the last three weeks they‚Äôve given up strong games to George Kittle, Harold Fannin Jr. and Brenton Strange. I just don‚Äôt see Minshew not using Kelce as his security blanket in this one.

title: VJ Edgecombe discusses battle with Cooper Flagg after Sixers beat Mavs
description: Rookie VJ Edgecombe discusses his battle with Cooper Flagg after the Philadelphia 76ers knock off the Dallas Mavericks.
fullText:
PHILADELPHIA -- The matchup between the Philadelphia 76ers and the Dallas Mavericks on Saturday night featured a matchup between the 2025 draft's No. 1 pick in Mavericks forward Cooper Flagg and the No. 3 pick in Sixes guard VJ Edgecombe.

The two delivered a terrific showing as Edgecombe had 26 points, six rebounds, and four assists while Flagg delivered 24 points and four rebounds as Philadelphia earned a 121-114 win on the second night of a back-to-back. It was a strong showing for two of the draft's top classmates.

After the Sixers knocked off the Mavs, the two rookies exchanged jerseys as a sign of respect for what both can do.

"It was great," Edgecombe said of the battle with Flagg. "We‚Äôve been going against each other since high school. College even, we ran into each other. Now in the league. I‚Äôm happy for him. He finally found a rhythm. Obviously, he had a shaky start kind of, but to see him play through it and continue to grow, that‚Äôs amazing, man. Credit to Coop."

Edgecombe and Flagg matched up in the NCAA Tournament back in March when Flagg's Duke team eliminated Edgecombe's Baylor squad in the Round of 32. Edgecombe was able to get a bit of revenge against Flagg at the NBA level leading the Sixers to another win. Flagg gave a lot of love to Edgecombe after the contest.

Cooper Flagg on his showdown with VJ Edgecombe:

"I think we both played a solid game. He played a really good game. He was aggressive. Got to his spots & rose up. I knew that's what he was capable of. He's a great player. Been playing against him for a couple years live now,‚Ä¶

‚Äî Mike Curtis (@MikeACurtis2) December 21, 2025

Edgecombe was part of a closing lineup on Saturday that played the final 13 minutes of the contest. He, Tyrese Maxey, Jared McCain, Jabari Walker, and Adem Bona were able to get the job done and put the Mavs away.

"We all just locked in," Edgecombe said. "Regardless of fatigue or not. We all just locked in. Credit to Mac coming onto the court and 'Bari and Bona coming onto the court and making big plays. Mac was plus-29. That's a big difference right there, man.¬†Credit to them, man.¬†Bona¬†played well, and¬†then Tyrese, obviously, is Tyrese."

The Sixers will have two days off before taking on the Brooklyn Nets on Tuesday.

This article originally appeared on Sixers Wire: VJ Edgecombe discusses battle with Cooper Flagg after Sixers beat Mavs

title: Mike Gesicki start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Mike Gesicki ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The 4-10 Cincinnati Bengals head down to South Beach to take on the 6-8 Miami Dolphins as 4.5-point favorites this Sunday. Joe Burrow will face off with Quinn Ewers in a battle of two eliminated teams. The Bengals are dealing with injuries to Tee Higgins and Noah Fant, but I still expect Joe Burrow to let it loose in south Florida with nothing to play for.

Below, we‚Äôll go over Mike Gesicki‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

Tee Higgins is questionable and needs to be cleared of his concussion before he can play, while TE Noah Fant is out. If Higgins is out, I feel pretty good about Gesicki and would start him. But if Higgins can play, it makes things a little tougher. I still like Gesicki‚Äôs upside with Fant out though,

The Dolphins have allowed the third-most fantasy points to tight ends this season and Gesicki had a strong game two weeks ago against a good tight end defense in Buffalo. Last week he did bupkis, but nobody on the Bengals did much of anything as they were shutout by the Ravens. I‚Äôd of course prefer Higgins was out if I‚Äôm playing Gesicki, but I think I‚Äôd start him either way.

title: Gunnar Helm start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Gunnar Helm ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The 2-12 Tennessee Titans welcome the 6-8 Kansas City Chiefs to Nashville. The Titans are just 3-point underdogs to the now Patrick Mahomes-less Chiefs, so this matchup looks much different than we expected when perusing the schedule early on. Of course, the Chiefs till have an above average defense and the Titans don‚Äôt have much offense to speak of, as they‚Äôve averaged just 16 this season.

Of course, even on bad teams, fantasy points will be scored. Of late, tight end Gunnar Helm has shown some fantasy upside with Two top ten fantasy games over his last four games. Has he shown enough to be startable in the fantasy playoffs though?

Below, we‚Äôll go over Gunnar Helm‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

Helm has caught four or more passes in four of his last five games and has shown himself to have a decent fantasy floor. A touchdown last week, his second of the season, helped boost him. And he has four red zone targets over the last three games.

The Chiefs rank fifth-best in fantasy points allowed to tight ends and Helm shares time with Chig Okonkwo. For the fantasy playoffs I would really prefer a tight end who consistently leads the team in tight end snap percentage. Helm also is more of a short catch and fall down kind of receiver. He‚Äôs not going to give you a whole lot after the catch.

title: Arsenal announce new partnership
description: Arsenal have confirmed a new partnership with WhatsApp and Facebook, a move designed to expand how supporters engage with the club across its digital platforms.Photo by Justin Setterfield/Getty Images...
fullText:
The agreement will see the two social media services become Official Partners, with the focus placed on strengthening communication with supporters and creating new shared spaces for fans worldwide.

Arsenal said the collaboration will roll out over the coming months and will centre on deeper storytelling, community interaction and improved access to club content.

Supporters can expect new ways to follow updates from across the club on WhatsApp and Facebook, alongside behind the scenes access spanning Arsenal‚Äôs teams.

The partnership will also introduce dedicated online spaces intended to bring supporters together and celebrate the club‚Äôs global fanbase.

The announcement reflects Arsenal‚Äôs continued emphasis on digital engagement, with the club increasingly using social platforms (but not Bluesky) to reach supporters beyond matchdays and traditional media.

Further details are set to be released in due course through Arsenal‚Äôs official channels.

title: Reacts Results: Guess where we are on the roller coaster?
description: The big question of 2025: Who are the Carolina Panthers? The answer: Nobody actually knows.
fullText:
Confidence go up. Confidence go down. This is the way of the Carolina Panthers and their fans. This season has been marked by remarkable highs and baffling lows, all tied together with the dueling beliefs that this team should be better and that this team is still in the middle of rebuilding.

We have learned things this season. Ejiro Evero‚Äôs defense plays best with a lead and with expectations. Bryce Young has no rhyme or reason behind when he excels and when he plays below the level of his opponent. Dave Canales is struggling with short yardage playcalls. These things are fairly well established at the moment. What is unclear is why any of those prior statements are true and how, exactly, they are related.

That confusion, bred by a stunningly predictable lack of consistency, has led to this season‚Äôs Reacts surveys reading like a heart monitor. The steady up and down is the pulse of the season and the patient being monitored is not well.

What happens today will help shape the final few beats of this season and create the tail end of what is already promising to be a hilarious graph for us to argue over this offseason.

title: Jaylen Waddle start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Jaylen Waddle ahead of Week 16
fullText:
The 6-8 Miami Dolphins host the 4-10 Cincinnati Bengals as 4.5-point home underdogs this Sunday. The line would likely be closer if Tua Tagovailoa were still behind center, but the team appears ready to move on from Tua and are giving rookie Quinn Ewers the start.

Usually, we‚Äôd start the Dolphins WR1, Jaylen Waddle, in most circumstances, but with Ewers behind center there is reason to think about hitting that start button ahead of the Week 16 fantasy playoffs.

Below, we‚Äôll go over Jaylen Waddle‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

Over his last four game, Waddle has finished as WR41, WR50, WR11, and WR72. Those games came against the Commanders, Saints, Jets and Steelers. As a Waddle backer, you were not happy about him coming up small in a stretch of easy matchups.

I‚Äôm not saying Tagovailoa was playing well, but I just don‚Äôt see Ewers playing better. It‚Äôs not out of the realm of possibility of course, and the good news is that they‚Äôll be in the warmth of Miami and playing a bad Bengals defense. Cincinnati has been good against outside receivers while giving up a million fantasy points to tight ends, but Waddle does get moved around enough to get him away from the boundaries.

There is risk involved here, but if anyone is going to get pelted with targets it‚Äôs going to be Waddle and his ability should take things from there.

title: Gasperini‚Äôs Ferguson claim a direct message to Brighton and Man United
description: Gian Piero Gasperini has done nothing to deny his disappointment towards Evan Ferguson, and his words sound like a transfer message for Brighton and Manchester United.Safe to say Roma coach Gasperini ...
fullText:
Gian Piero Gasperini has done nothing to deny his disappointment towards Evan Ferguson, and his words sound like a transfer message for Brighton and Manchester United.

Safe to say Roma coach Gasperini is unhappy with Irish striker Ferguson.

The Brighton loanee contributed to Roma‚Äôs only goal against Juventus on Saturday, but Gasp was still unhappy with his performance and, overall, attitude.

GLASGOW, SCOTLAND ‚Äì NOVEMBER 06: Gian Piero Gasperini, Head Coach of AS Roma, looks on prior to the UEFA Europa League 2025/26 League Phase MD4 match between Rangers FC and AS Roma at Ibrox Stadium on November 06, 2025 in Glasgow, Scotland. (Photo by Ian MacNicol/Getty Images)

‚ÄúFerguson is still not convincing me, including in the second half today,‚Äù Gasperini told Sky Sport.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not just his technique; he and a few other new signings still haven‚Äôt settled fully into the spirit of this team.‚Äù

A few minutes later, he added at a press conference attended by Football Italia: ‚ÄúIf I have to choose between Dybala and Ferguson, I‚Äôd choose Dybala every time. It‚Äôs not about Ferguson; it‚Äôs a choice I‚Äôve made before, and if that‚Äôs the choice, I choose Dybala.‚Äù

Ferguson joined Roma on loan with a ‚Ç¨35m option to buy from Brighton last summer, but the 21-year-old has only scored three goals in 17 appearances across all competitions this season.

It‚Äôs no secret that Roma are looking for a new centre forward in the January transfer window, and Football Italia reported earlier this week that Giacomo Raspadori has already given the green light for a move to the Olimpico, although Gasp‚Äôs priority remains Manchester United‚Äôs forward Joshua Zirkzee.

Gasperini had previously claimed that Ferguson would have time to prove his worth at the Olimpico, but with the January window approaching, the Italian tactician seems to have lost patience with the Irish striker, who is clearly not seen as a starter by Gasp.

Under such circumstances, it would not be surprising to see Roma send Ferguson back to Brighton in the January window, a scenario that even the English club‚Äôs coach Fabian Hurzeler refused to rule out just a few days ago.

Gasperini seems to have lost faith in Ferguson, but he‚Äôd still need one or, ideally, two reinforcements in attack in the winter transfer window before sending the Irish striker back to England, a move that would also require Brighton‚Äôs approval.

NOTTINGHAM, ENGLAND ‚Äì APRIL 01: Joshua Zirkzee of Manchester United looks on as he walks out of the tunnel to inspect the pitch prior to during the Premier League match between Nottingham Forest FC and Manchester United FC at City Ground on April 01, 2025 in Nottingham, England. (Photo by Carl Recine/Getty Images)

Gasperini also argued that he won‚Äôt necessarily need a classic centre-forward to play up front, given that even using Dybala as a false nine is a better option than fielding Ferguson.

Neither Raspadori nor Zirkzee is are classic centre-forward, but their dynamism and ability in the link-up play will suit Gasperini‚Äôs playing style. The Italian tactician already wanted to sign both players at Atalanta in the past, and he certainly hopes that both can move to the Olimpico next month to boost Roma‚Äôs hopes to finish in the top four.

‚ÄúWe must aim to improve, and I hope the January transfer window can help us do that. It‚Äôs not easy, but we have to believe,‚Äù Gasperini concluded last night.

title: Former Head Coach Gives Inter Milan The Cold Shoulder In Riyadh ‚Äì Did Not Show Up In Inter Zones
description: There was no reunion in Riyadh between Inter and their former head coach Simone Inzaghi, despite expectations that the two parties might cross paths during the Supercoppa Italiana.Inter were in Saudi ...
fullText:
There was no reunion in Riyadh between Inter and their former head coach Simone Inzaghi, despite expectations that the two parties might cross paths during the Supercoppa Italiana.

Inter were in Saudi Arabia for the semi-final against Bologna, a match they ultimately lost on penalties.

Meanwhile Inzaghi has been based in the country since his summer move to Al-Hilal from Inter.

In recent weeks, the former Nerazzurri coach had hinted that he could take the opportunity to greet his old players during the tournament.

That meeting, however, never materialised.

MUNICH, GERMANY ‚Äì MAY 31: Simone Inzaghi, Head Coach of FC Internazionale, reacts during the UEFA Champions League Final 2025 between Paris Saint-Germain and FC Internazionale Milano at Munich Football Arena on May 31, 2025 in Munich, Germany. (Photo by Dan Mullan/Getty Images)

According to Tuttosport, via FCInterNews, Inzaghi did not appear in any of Inter‚Äôs designated areas throughout the trip.

‚ÄúNeither on Thursday, when Inter arrived in Saudi Arabia, nor on Friday, the day of the match against Bologna, did Inzaghi show up in Inter‚Äôs zones,‚Äù the paper reports.

Indeed referring to the team hotel, training centre and the Al-Awwal Stadium.

Tuttosport suggests it may have been a matter of discretion, avoiding distractions for the squad on the eve of an important match.

Alternatively, the newspaper hints that relations may no longer be entirely smooth following Inzaghi‚Äôs departure after the Champions League final.

Although, no confirmation is offered.

What is certain is that Inter‚Äôs Saudi trip passed without any direct contact with their former coach, closing the door, at least for now, on a symbolic reunion during the Supercoppa.

title: Argentina Megastar Set To Return To Inter Milan Starting XI Against Atalanta After Being Benched In Bologna Defeat
description: Inter are expected to return to a more familiar starting XI against Atalanta, with Lautaro Martinez set to lead the line after being rested in the Supercoppa defeat to Bologna.After flying back from S...
fullText:
Inter are expected to return to a more familiar starting XI against Atalanta, with Lautaro Martinez set to lead the line after being rested in the Supercoppa defeat to Bologna.

After flying back from Saudi Arabia on Wednesday evening, Cristian Chivu reconvened the squad at Appiano Gentile for a recovery session.

Indeed, with the possibility of granting the group a short Christmas break, via FCInterNews.

The focus, however, quickly shifts back to Serie A and a demanding trip to Bergamo following the disappointment in Riyadh.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì OCTOBER 04: Cristian Chivu, Head Coach of Internazionale, looks on prior to the Serie A match between FC Internazionale and US Cremonese at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on October 04, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

According to La Gazzetta dello Sport, the Inter coach plans to reinstate all the regular starters who were spared minutes in the Supercoppa semi-final.

In defence, Akanji is expected to return.

Meanwhile Hakan Calhanoglu is set to reclaim his place in midfield.

Up front, Lautaro is tipped to start from the first minute after beginning on the bench against Bologna.

Chivu still has a couple of decisions to resolve.

In goal, Yann Sommer is expected to regain his spot despite a solid showing from Josep Martinez in the Supercoppa.

In midfield, Piotr Zielinski is pushing to start, putting pressure on Mkhitaryan.

There could also be a change on the right flank.

Gazzetta suggests that Andy Diouf may be preferred to Luis Henrique.

With little time to dwell on the Supercoppa exit, Inter now look to respond immediately.

title: Insider shuts down Bayern Munich transfer links with Barcelona star
description: Barcelona could part ways with one or two players in January, as they seek to continue cutting down their wage bill. Marc-Andre Ter Stegen is a prime candidate to move on, given that he is not in Hans...
fullText:
Barcelona could part ways with one or two players in January, as they seek to continue cutting down their wage bill. Marc-Andre Ter Stegen is a prime candidate to move on, given that he is not in Hansi Flick‚Äôs plans for the second half of the season.

Ter Stegen recently made his return to action in the victory over Guadalajara in the Copa del Rey, but Flick has Joan Garcia and Wojciech Szczesny as first team goalkeepers for the 2025-26 campaign. Because of this, he‚Äôs been told he can leave, which he will need to do if he wants tpostart for Germany at next summer‚Äôs World Cup.

A number of clubs have been linked with Ter Stegen, and among them is Bayern Munich. However, Christian Falk has now shut down any chance of a move to Bavaria for the Barcelona captain.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a really good goalkeeper, but there are no meetings taking place within the club to discuss him signing for FC Bayern. There is an interesting set of circumstances at the club. As we know, Jonas Urbig is considered the backup and eventual successor to first-choice Manuel Neuer. Urbig also shares the same agent as Ter Stegen, so they don‚Äôt want to bring a rival into the club.

‚ÄúThat all said, Ter Stegen knows he has to move if he wants to play in the World Cup for Germany. This is why there is so much speculation around his future. I think an idea like Manchester United, for example, is more plausible. Otherwise, there are many interested clubs; Besiktas would be a relatively easy move for the Barcelona star in order to get playing time, as he has no chance of playing next year for Barca; Hansi Flick is very clear on this position.

‚ÄúNeuer is still, firmly, the number one goalkeeper at Bayern Munich, so it wouldn‚Äôt make any sense to bring Marc-Andr√© ter Stegen in. He‚Äôs already been sitting on the bench for the German national team behind Manuel Neuer, and he won‚Äôt do it at Bayern!‚Äù

Bayern may not be in the race, but Ter Stegen has numerous options. Several clubs in the Premier League want him, and regular playing there would certainly give him an excellent chance of being Germany‚Äôs staring goalkeeper at the 2026 World Cup.

title: Patriots playoff picture: Rooting guide for Week 16 games around NFL
description: Who Patriots fans should be rooting for in Week 16 of the 2025 NFL season.
fullText:
The New England Patriots will try to get back into the win column this week versus the Baltimore Ravens. Naturally, all of our attention is on that particular Sunday night matchup. That said, some of the other 15 games around the NFL this week are also worth keeping a close eye on.

With that said, welcome to this week‚Äôs Patriots rooting guide.

As a disclaimer, we are looking at games through two primary lenses: New England‚Äôs chances of winning the division ‚Äî which they cannot do this week ‚Äî as well as earning the No. 1 seed in the AFC. Naturally and given the tiebreaker situation, not every game will be equally important even if it involves common opponents or other teams in the conference or division.

The Patriots were entering the weekend with a 73% chance of winning the division, according to The Athletic, and are 99+% favorite to make the playoffs (they actually can punch their ticket on Sunday). Their odds for the No. 1 seed are not nearly as good and a mere 10% at the moment.

Tampa Bay Buccaneers (7-7) at Carolina Panthers (7-7): Go good game! Division supremacy on the line, but the Patriots do not care who will win this one. | FOX

Buffalo Bills (10-4) at Cleveland Browns (3-11): Go Browns! The Patriots won‚Äôt lock up the division this week either way, but Buffalo dropping this one would give them more wiggle room: if the Bills lose and they beat the Ravens, the Patriots would be up two games with two weeks to go. | CBS

Los Angeles Chargers (10-4) at Dallas Cowboys (6-7-1): Go Cowboys! The Chargers entering the competition for the No. 1 seed in the AFC is unlikely but not entirely impossible. This is merely based on keeping another competitor away from the race for the first-round bye in the conference. | FOX

Cincinnati Bengals (4-10) at Miami Dolphins (6-8): Go Dolphins! Miami is out of the playoffs, so all wins do over the last three weeks is further weaken the team‚Äôs draft position. | CBS

New York Jets (3-11) at New Orleans Saints (4-10): Go Jets! This is the same we talked about with the Dolphins, namely that the Jets adding some more wins down the stretch would end up hurting their draft stock. | CBS

Minnesota Vikings (6-8) at New York Giants (2-12): Go good game! This all-NFC matchup has no impact on the Patriots. | FOX

Kansas City Chiefs (6-8) at Tennessee Titans (2-12): Go Titans! The more games the Chiefs end up losing, the better for New England: they own a Kansas City sixth-rounder next year courtesy of the Joshua Uche trade. The worse their record, the better positioned the pick. | CBS

Atlanta Falcons (5-9) at Arizona Cardinals (3-11): Go good game! Nothing to see here, really. | FOX

Jacksonville Jaguars (10-4) at Denver Broncos (12-2): Go Jaguars! This is a big one. If the Patriots want to take over the No. 1 seed in the AFC, they will need Denver to start losing some games. This one against the red hot Jaguars is a realistic candidate. | FOX

Pittsburgh Steelers (8-6) at Detroit Lions (8-6): Go Lions! The Steelers missing out on the playoffs would be good news for the Patriots and the sixth-round draft pick they received as part of the Kyle Dugger trade. Obviously, in an ideal scenario, Pittsburgh would still be ahead of the Ravens after Week 16, but a loss here would keep the chances intact of Baltimore eventually leap-frogging their division rivals and pushing them out of postseason contention. | CBS

Las Vegas Raiders (2-12) at Houston Texans (9-5): Go good game! Even though this is a game between two AFC teams, including one competing for a playoff spot, the game has no real impact on New England. | CBS

San Francisco 49ers (10-4) at Indianapolis Colts (8-6): Go Colts! We end the week with a focus on draft positioning. In the unlikely case the 49ers drop out of the playoff picture in the NFC, the Patriots would benefit: the conditional sixth-round pick acquired in the Keion White trade would be better positioned in that case. | ESPN

The following games have taken place earlier in the week:

Los Angeles Rams (11-3) at Seattle Seahawks (11-3): Go good game! Given the stakes, this is one of the top Thursday night games in recent memories. And while it has no impact on the Patriots, it should be a fun watch nonetheless. | LA 37, SEA 38 (OT)

Philadelphia Eagles (9-5) at Washington Commanders (4-10): Go good game! A no-impact game from a Patriots perspective. | PHI 29, WAS 18

Green Bay Packers (9-4-1) at Chicago Bears (10-4): Go Packers! While the game won‚Äôt change New England‚Äôs playoff outlook, it could end up impacting the draft. The Patriots, after all, own the Bears‚Äô fourth-round pick sent to them by the Chiefs as part of an in-draft trade last year. | GB 16, CHI 22 (OT)

This article also serves as an open thread for this week‚Äôs games. Please head down to the comment section to discuss and share your thoughts on the games as they unfold.

title: Keys for the Browns defense in limiting the Bills offense
description: The Bills are one of the Browns tougher opponents this season and will provide and interesting challenge for the defense
fullText:
All eyes are on Myles Garrett this week as he is 1.5 sacks away from claiming the all-time NFL sack single-season record. He will be chasing that record this week, but beyond Garrett, the Cleveland Browns defense will be a¬†huge¬†factor in the game against the Buffalo Bills.

While sacks will be a priority for Garrett, it¬†is known¬†that Josh Allen can extend plays with his legs, so the Cleveland pass rushers will need to prioritize limiting him in these situations rather than just aiming for sacks. If they can keep Allen in the pocket, they may be able to limit¬†Buffalo‚Äôs¬†explosive offense.

The Bills¬†are built¬†to score often and quickly, so limiting explosive plays will be crucial for the¬†Browns‚Äô¬†defense. There needs to be an emphasis on tackling and limiting¬†big¬†gains that will allow Buffalo to move down the field quickly.¬†Cleveland‚Äôs¬†offense struggles when playing from behind, making it crucial for the defense to avoid putting the team in that situation.

In every game, third-down stops and stops in the red zone are always a key to keeping the Browns in games, and it is no different for this game. Limiting the Bills to field goals and forcing them to punt will keep the Browns competitive.

Let me know what you think in the comments ‚Äì What are the keys for the Browns defense in limiting the Bills offense?

title: Jalen Coker start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Jalen Coker ahead of the Panthers‚Äô Week 16 matchup vs. the Buccaneers.
fullText:
Week 16 of the 2025 NFL season continues on this afternoon with an NFC South battle for first place featuring the Tampa Bay Buccaneers visiting the Carolina Panthers at 1 p.m. ET on FOX.

The Panthers held on to the NFC South lead for less than 72 hours before squandering it in a 20-17 loss to the Saints last Sunday, falling back behind the Bucs due to the common opponent tiebreaker. They did get a productive outing out of Coker and they are going to need him to come through with another good performance in this crucial home showdown.

Below, we‚Äôll go over Coker‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

Coker made an impact in last Sunday‚Äôs loss to the Saints, leading the team in receiving by catching all four of his targets for 60 yards and a touchdown. That trip to the end zone gave the Panthers a 10-point lead in the third quarter and that proved to be the end of their scoring for the afternoon as the Saints marched their way back into the contest and nailed a game-winning field goal with two second left.

This marked the second straight game with a touchdown for the second-year wideout from Holy Cross and he‚Äôs really coming on as a reliable weapon for Bryce Young in the last month. He‚Äôs been uber reliable with a 75.9% catch rate, ranking ninth among his peers in that category. We‚Äôll see if he can step up yet again in this showdown.

Start. Given how the Bucs defense has been shredded through the air in recent weeks, I like the young receiver‚Äôs chances of finding the end zone again in today‚Äôs matchup. I‚Äôd give him a Flex nod in your lineup if you have him.

title: Will Chris Jones play today? Status report for Chiefs DL in Week 16
description: Will Chiefs DL Chris Jones take the field to face the Titans today? Here's the latest update on Jones' status.
fullText:
Star pass-rusher Chris Jones was listed on all of the Kansas City Chiefs' injury reports this week ahead of the team's matchup against the Tennessee Titans.

Will Jones' injury affect his ability to take the field in today's game?

Here's the latest update on Jones' status:

Jones is said to be dealing with a hamstring injury and started the week as a limited participant in the Chiefs' practice sessions on Wednesday and Thursday. He was a full participant in the team's workouts on Friday.

The Chiefs did not give Jones an official game status designation for Week 16, so he shouldn't need to miss any time due to his hamstring injury.

If Jones aggravates his hamstring injury and needs to exit today's game, Kansas City will expect veteran linemen Mike Pennel and Jerry Tillery to anchor the middle part of its front-four.

title: üêêMbapp√© matches CR7, celebrates with "Siuuu", Cristiano replies üòç
description: Last night, on his 27th birthday, Kylian Mbapp√© reached 59 goals in the calendar year (his first full year) with Real Madrid: equaling Cristiano Ronaldo's record from 2013.A special moment for the Fr...
fullText:
Last night, on his 27th birthday, Kylian Mbapp√© reached 59 goals in the calendar year (his first full year) with Real Madrid: equaling Cristiano Ronaldo's record from 2013.

A special moment for the Frenchman, who has reached his lifelong idol. That's why he celebrated just like him, talked about it in the post-match interview, and tagged him on social media.

After scoring the penalty for the 2-0 against Sevilla, Mbapp√© "borrowed" CR7's celebration to mark his 59 goals in the calendar year, which cannot be increased further, since Real Madrid's next match will be on January 4th.

After all, it's not the first time Mbapp√© has imitated Cristiano Ronaldo‚Äîjust think back to his presentation day, when he said in front of the Bernabeu: "Un, dos, tres... Hala Madrid!"

After last night's goal, Mbapp√© himself wanted to pay tribute to CR7: "Cristiano helped me adapt to Real Madrid. We talked a lot. It was great. I have my own way of celebrating, but I wanted to dedicate this goal to him."

After the match, Mbapp√© made a post on Instagram with photos of his celebration, the caption "Believe in your dreams, champ!" and an image that has now become iconic: a very young 13-year-old Kylian together with Cristiano Ronaldo. The occasion was a multi-day trial at Valdebebas with Real Madrid, which ultimately did not result in a transfer.

CR7 himself commented on the post: just a few simple emojis, but they sum up the excellent relationship between the two, now united by the same number of goals in a calendar year. 59‚Äîno one else has done it like them at Real Madrid.

This article was translated into English by Artificial Intelligence. You can read the original version in üáÆüáπ here.

title: Troy Franklin start or sit: Week 16 fantasy football advice
description: We break down the fantasy football outlook of Troy Franklin ahead of the Broncos‚Äô Week 16 matchup vs. the Jaguars.
fullText:
Week 16 of the 2025 NFL season continues on this afternoon with an AFC matchup with playoff implications as the Jacksonville Jaguars will visit the Denver Broncos at 4:05 p.m. ET on FOX.

The Broncos downed the Packers in a big-time 34-26 victory over the Packers last Sunday and can secure the AFC West title with a win and a Chargers loss this afternoon. Wide receiver Troy Franklin came up huge for the team last week and they‚Äôll need another great performance out of him against another playoff contender in this one.

Below, we‚Äôll go over Franklin‚Äôs outlook in fantasy football for Week 16.

Franklin delivered one of his better performances of the season against the Packers last Sunday, catching all six of his targets for 85 yards and a touchdown in a victory that clinched the Broncos the AFC‚Äôs first playoff spot. It was the first game of the season where he had a perfect catch rate and his 23-yard touchdown reception as time expired in the third quarter ended up putting the Broncos ahead for good.

That effort allowed Franklin finish the week as a top-10 fantasy wideout in all scoring formats, marking the third time this season where he‚Äôs pulled that off. The second-year wideout from Oregon continues to be an effective weapon for Bo Nix and it will be interesting to see if he can keep it up against the Jags this afternoon.

Sit. A couple of things should be noted here for this matchup.
